file_content.text: If you came to try your luck at the gambling tables, I'm sorry to disappoint you.
The casino is closed until further notice. Republic military forces have re-appropriated it for the war effort.
You know where a man named Curao might have fled to?
I'm looking for someone.
He was arrested trying to bribe General Garza. What business had you with him?
No doubt the usual sort of business. My assistant Hreda, of the Drall.
Hey, the furball speaks.
I've got no time for this.
Then get out of my way.
I am Hreda, of the Drall, archivist to the Master Jedi advisor of the Republic forces! I have earned no insult from you.
Seem the war didn't heed our wish Captain. Though Shariss made it back alive and whole.
I trust you're here with Senator Dodonna? She arrived days ago and has been overhauling our strategy against the Empire.
Stop her! She's selling the Republic to the Voidwolf so she can become supreme dictator of her own little world.
Dodonna's an Imperial agent!
Very convenient, you showing up here. I'm not answering any questions.
I don't trust you.
You trusted me once, Captain. Has something changed?
Sorry. I get cranky when I've been jerked around by an Imperial agent disguised as a Senator.
That's quite an accusation... considering Dodonna's word is your only source of credibility in the Republic.
Do you have proof? The Senate will require evidence.
Let's think less "put her on trial," and more "apparently unmotivated revenge killing."
We don't need proof.
Every Senator is under guard by multiple units of our best troopers. You need to do this legally.
We should go after Darmas, first. No one's defending him.
What about Darmas? Maybe we can get him to turn against Dodonna, testify or something.
Take Darmas first.
It looked like Darmas was Dodonna's handler. If you find him, you'll find your evidence.
Would it be illegal to beat Darmas up until he's willing to testify against Dodonna?
What about Darmas Pollaran? That was the scandal of Coruscant--the gambler and the Senator. Perhaps he knows something.
I saw a recording of her asking when the Voidwolf would reward her.
I saw her.
She was asking Darmas Pollaran! Were you planning on leaving his name out of this?
It was all Darmas's fault. I wish I'd never introduced you!
What about Darmas?
Darmas Pollaran was clearly the primary agent.
Wasn't she asking Darmas--? Oh! Were you trying to cover that part up? Right. I'm totally with you.
I watched a recording of her and Darmas plotting to betray the Republic.
I saw her and Darmas.
Darmas Pollaran was working with her. Maybe we can get him to turn on her.
She's got a partner.
Darmas Pollaran? His relationship with Dodonna has been the top scandal on Coruscant.
Someone's trying to frame her as a traitor. I want to find the truth.
I'm worried about Dodonna.
Unfortunately, this isn't the first accusation I've heard.
The Senate has been investigating Dodonna for some time.
They say she's linked romantically with a gambler, Darmas Pollaran, who may have ties to Imperial Intelligence.
Oddly enough, I'm looking for him, too.
Where can I find Darmas?
Darmas... and Dodonna? No!
Ow, don't say romantically....
This is one of those times it's okay to say "I told you so," right?
Gosh, what a shame.
Humans....
Perhaps this will teach you to be less... indiscriminate.
Boy, those two don't do betrayal halfway.
Darmas is on my list, too.
The traitor!
Then I need to find them before they finish whatever they're plotting.
So it's true.
Darmas will be easier to investigate. If he'll turn against Dodonna, his testimony could be enough to convict.
Hreda, check our records. Darmas Pollaran's a known criminal; does the SIS list any aliases or safe houses he's used on Corellia?
Darmas is no Imperial! Dodonna must have led him into this.
That's a lie!
It is hard to imagine an Imperial spy spending so many years in Coruscant's gambling dens.
Regardless, he should be in our records. Hreda can find a list of any aliases or safe houses he uses on Corellia.
Hmm. According to the databanks, he co-owns a cantina and maintains a private residence there. I can send you the coordinates....
You think I'll stumble over Darmas just sitting at home?
That isn't much to go on.
It's a place to start. Maybe you'll find out what his plans are, or where he is now.
I'm not hunting him down like a criminal... I mean, he may be a criminal, but he's no traitor!
Darmas is innocent.
Then the Republic has the wrong man in their sights.
A slug like Darmas always leaves a nice slimy trail.
I'll find him.
No offense, Master Jedi, but for the rest of this, I'm on my own.
Now stay out of my business.
Believe me, you don't want to try bringing down a Senator without help.
If you wish to prove Darmas Pollaran innocent, you must find him and beg him to cooperate with us against Senator Dodonna.
Search his homes. Call me if you find anything that may clear his name.
Check all the addresses; see if there's been any recent communications--between Darmas and Dodonna, or any allies on Corellia.
If you find anything useful... I'm waiting on the link.
Do you have any proof?
Perhaps Risha will be more willing to share the truth.
If you don't start mixing with a better crowd, they're going to take away those robes, Sumalee.
Your captain is hiding something from me, Risha. What should I know?
How much do you know about this so-called Jedi?
Can we trust Sumalee?
After what happened, I don't think we should trust any more sweet, well-meaning agents of the Republic.
Don't say anything!
I knew Sumalee before you flew your first ship. She's as true as they come.
Senator Dodonna's gone over to the Empire, Sumalee. The Voidwolf bought her.
Search carefully, Captain.
